title: Davey Lloyd evicted
text:
The Bachelorette Australia 2015: Richie Strahan's timewarp date, Davey Lloyd evicted TV and Radio 
Please Log in to update your video settings 
Video will begin in 5 seconds. 
Please Log in to update your video settings Trailer: The Bachelorette - meet the families Sam faces an army of protective family members and their awkward questions when she embarks on hometown visits. PT0M39S http://www.smh.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-445jb 620 349 October 9, 2015 - 6:38AM Tony, Kayne sent home 
While Davey Lloyd held onto his spot in Wednesday's episode, it seems Bachelorette Sam Frost wasn't keen to prolong her exposure to the 25-year-old carpenter and self-described "child". 
Davey left the house after Frost made the dramatic decision that the larrikin wasn't quite ready to settle down yet. 
Alex felt the pressure in the carnival challenge. 
"I wonder if the sensitive side to your personality is just an act?" she asked him at the cocktail party. "My first gut reaction to you is that you're a ladies man. Advertisement 
"I've dated people like you before, and you give them the benefit of the time and every time the same thing happens. 
"I'm not used to this sense of pressure," Davey admitted. "I can't bulls--- to you, but I am here for all the right reasons. Every part of me wants to be here." 
Davey began the show well with a carnival win. 
Moments later the news of Davey's departure was broken to the other men and the rose ceremony was cancelled. 
The episode began with a group date. Alex, Sasha, Dave, Davey and Michael were invited into a carnival-themed showdown for some more solo time with Frost, a 26-year-old marketing professional from Victoria. 
"I will crawl over your dead bodies to win this," said Michael. 
Dave (not Davey) won the group date at the carnival. 
Activities included Thunder God, a test of brute strength in which Davey reigned supreme. 
"Davey is being quite the boy's boy today which I can't say I'm surprised, but I can't help wonder if that was just a brief encounter" Sam observed. 
By the fifth and final round only Dave and Davey were left standing. Thirty-year-old NSW plumber Dave won the battle, sharing a drink with Sam under the carnival big top. 
Richie breaks down recalling the timewarp date. 
The date ended in a hug. 
Later in the episode, Sam took 30-year-old Richie Strahan on a single date that could only happen on reality television. 
Special effects transformed the pair into a couple in their 80s who were celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary. 
Richie and Sam on their way to a lawnbowls date. 
"This is a very unusual date, it's very quirky," said Richie who travelled to a local lawn bowls club for bingo and dancing. 
The date was a huge success. 
"She's definitely someone I can have a long future with and most of all just be really happy," Richie said. 
Richie and Sam watch a video message from his mother and sister. 
Sam said "no guy has ever made me laugh as much as Richie has. I feel like I'm the only girl in the world and that's what everyone dreams for". 
The pair also bonded over having divorced parents and how that has stunted their ability to imagine longevity in relationships. 
"I guess I've been so scared of thinking in this day and age that people can't have long term marriages," Sam said. 
The date ended with a video message from Richie's mum and sister, sharing stories from his childhood and youth, a kiss and Richie receiving a rose.
